summary: Based on the provided documents, Harry Wachtel is mentioned in connection with investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents primarily summarize the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) in 1975. Wachtel's specific role or significance is not detailed within these summaries, but his association with King, the SCLC, and Levison places him within the context of civil rights era investigations and potential surveillance activities. The documents focus on electronic surveillance, alleged communist connections, and FBI operational policies related to these individuals and organizations. The timeline of involvement is not explicitly defined, but the documents suggest an ongoing investigation during the period when Sentinella was an active FBI agent.
significance: The provided documents do not directly link Harry Wachtel to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his association with individuals and organizations targeted by the FBI during the civil rights era, as detailed in the testimony of Alan G. Sentinella. Without further context, it is difficult to assess his specific role or importance in relation to the JFK assassination.
